com.github.westonpace.jayvee.workflow

Class DirectCallBuffer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.westonpace.jayvee.workflow.DirectCallBuffer<T>

  • public class DirectCallBuffer<T>
extends Object
    A buffer which can be used for OnRequestOnly workers. When a pop request comes in the iterate method is called on the underlying worker and the result is passed in to the pop request.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DirectCallBuffer(Worker worker) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void end()
      Inserts an 'end' item into a sink.

      Reads the next item from the source.

      Inserts the next item into the sink.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DirectCallBuffer

        public DirectCallBuffer(Worker worker)

    • Method Detail

      • push

        public void push(T value)
        Description copied from interface: Sink
        Inserts the next item into the sink. May block until the sink is ready to accept more data (e.g. a buffer is full)
        Parameters:
        value - The item to insert into the sink

      • end

        public void end()
        Description copied from interface: Sink

        Inserts an 'end' item into a sink. Once ended a sink is no longer usable. Once the other side reads the end item they will know that there is no more data being sent.

        This should not be called by workers, workers should set isEnded to true instead.

      • pop

        public T pop()
        Description copied from interface: Source
        Reads the next item from the source. This may block until an item is available and will throw a BufferEndedException if the source is finished and will never have any more items.
        Returns:
        The next item
